discourse_list.title: [Discussion] Using Large Cap Coin as Collateral Offchain

content.content: This post is more for sentiment check For Maker protocol, there are many criteria in order to be a collateral but traditionally coins and tokens need to be liquid onchain (such as DEX on Ethereum) to be eventually onboarded. And this is not unique to Maker, other leading ETH based DeFi protocols such as Compound and AAVE also consider onchain liqudidity as important aspect of the collateral assessment. As I have hear feedback from various projects, I realized that there’s a missing market at the moment where very large cap and liquid coins on Centralized Exchanges (or other chains) are interested in providing large collateral and mint a large amount of Dai but they also understand that as their liquidity on ETH mainnet is low or non existent, it’s very unlikely to be onboarded. However, as RWA has been gaining attention for Maker Protocol, I realized that while the structure will be of course very different, in theory, it might be possible for Maker protocol to create a system where it holds collateral token in custody such as exchanges or OTC desks where if it is liquidated, is still able to sell them on the market to ensure the debt is repaid back (because they are liquid enough to handle millions on the market). And this also means potential large institutions that want to use BTC rather than WBTC might be able to access Maker protocol as well. But before I think more about this kind of set up, I was curious about the community’s feedback. Initially, I believe only coins with:  More than $2 Billion in Circulating Marketcap More than $200 million in daily Trading Volume or better option would be examining ways to measure liquidity to see whether they can handle large sell off. Willing to mint significant amount of Dai (which we will examine in this poll)

As the above poll didn’t show who voted. I reposted the polls for greater transparency. My apology. How much Dai should such Coins at least mint to qualify?     Higher than 100 Million 100 Million 50 Million 20 Million Abstain     0 voters     Do you believe such set up is a good idea to explore?     Yes, I believe it’s a good idea to explore No, I don’t think it’s a good idea to explore Abstain     0 voters
This is good idea! It would not even be extra oracles expense to allow pure bitcoin collateral

Yes, expanding on this point especially on BTC, as converting BTC to WBTC itself has friction and many more institutions are much more comfortable with mainnet Bitcoin, it will likely to be more favorable. And I agree with lack of onchain oracle as well. It is one of obstacles for onboarding onchain collaterals at the moment.     Puzzler:  It would not even be extra oracles expense to allow pure bitcoin collateral
Just curious, for those who responded with “Higher than 100 Million”. How much are you thinking?

Good idea to explore but not a priority for now. This market is competitive and complex. We are not yet able to just invest in anything in the real-world, therefore holding collateral for others on custody seems more complex, unproven and less scalable.
The biggest challenge apart from custody risk in my view would be another layer of reliance on external liquidation process. It’s same kind of risk with RWAs but these assets are much less volatile.
But on the flipside, they are much more liquid than RWAs. For example, I think selling 50 million worth of BTC is easier than auctioning off 50 million worth of real estate.

Technically, I guess partners like Nexo can act as custody and liquidator while the Maker Protocol provides Dai for the loan. Then Maker doesn’t need to hold collateral directly. Now of course, the devil is in the details so a lot of questions need to be answered.

In summary, a majority of respondents believed that using large cap coin as collateral offchain is a good idea to explore and many believed that such candidate should be willing to mint at least 100 million DAI or more. Of course, details will need to be hammered out but good to engage the sentiment in the community.
Will you give us any clue as to which would be the candidate… example, what is the top in the marketcxap? if it is an EVM or something like that?

Good idea to diversify with crypto and should be easier to do than RWA.     Puzzler:  This is good idea! It would not even be extra oracles expense to allow pure bitcoin collateral   Not exactly true. Even RWA requires a “liquidation oracle” contract. BTC or some other coin would need something similar. It should even be possible to have a price feed oracle activate a liquidation or sell bot depending on custody. I’d push for a trusted setup using smart contracts like that.

There are several but more serious discussion will be those that can fulfill such:     Doo_StableLab:   More than $2 Billion in Circulating Marketcap More than $200 million in daily Trading Volume    So basically top 50 projects in terms of circulating marketcap. Some are EVM compatible. Some are not.
